ground_truth: Henry has clearly been concentrating entirely on the vase, and he is examining the broken end carefully. Henry throws the vase against the wall where it shatters. Indy steps to the door and stands, listening. Henry slides his umbrella through the straps of his bag, and Indy nods. Henry laughs genuinely, believing himself to be laughing at the expense of the S.S. Officer. He's so pissed off, he literally rips a machine gun from the hands of one of the startled soldiers. He turns and sprays the room with machine gun fire, cutting all three Nazis to ribbons and blowing them backwards across the room. Henry looks shocked and horrified. Indy grabs him and pushes him ahead, leading Henry down the hallway as he searches for Elsa. He opens a door and enters. Indy and Henry rush back into the room where Elsa had been left, only to find a Nazi Colonel holding Elsa hostage. He looks at Elsa, then back to his father. Everyone is yelling at once. Vogel jams the barrel of the Luger painfully into Elsa's neck, and Elsa screams. He drops the machine gun to the table and it slides across, shattering glass. Vogel releases his grip on Elsa and shoves her toward Indy. She is propelled directly into his arms, and he holds her tightly. Her hand slips into his coat pocket and removes the Grail Diary. She steps back next to Vogel, and Indy is stunned. A large baronial room is decorated with ancient tapestries and suits of armor. Indy and Henry are ushered in, hands tied behind their backs, accompanied by Vogel and Elsa and two Nazi guards. Elsa crosses the room toward a high-backed chair facing the fireplace. Indy and Henry do not have the advantage of seeing who is sitting in that chair. They only see a hand reach out. Indy looks at Henry with surprise. The man in the chair gets to his feet and turns, revealing himself to be Walter Donovan. Donovan smiles benignly and flips through the Grail Diary. Elsa rushes to Donovan's side and takes the Grail Diary from him. Elsa takes a look for herself, then glances up at Indy. Brody disembarks from the train along with the other passengers, a cross-section of Arabs and Tuskens. A man in the crowd holds out a cup of water to Brody, who continues through the crowd past various street vendors. A woman holds a chicken out to him, and then the woman walks away, leaving Brody alone in the crowd. Sallah shoulders his way through the mob toward Brody. They meet and hug, then begin to walk. Brody searches in his coat pocket for the map as a sinister man approaches, and Brody puts the map back in his pocket.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Henry has obviously been focusing entirely on the vessel, and he is inspecting the fractured extremity meticulously. Henry hurls the vessel against the barrier where it fragments. Indy strides to the entrance and stands, hearing. Henry slides his parasol through the loops of his sack, and Indy nods. Henry chuckles sincerely, believing himself to be chuckling at the expense of the S.S. Officer. He's so infuriated, he literally snatches a submachine gun from the grasp of one of the startled troopers. He turns and sprays the chamber with submachine gun fire, slicing all three Nazis to pieces and propelling them backward across the chamber. Henry looks appalled and aghast. Indy seizes him and pushes him ahead, guiding Henry down the corridor as he searches for Elsa. He opens an entrance and enters. Indy and Henry rush back into the chamber where Elsa had been left, only to find a Nazi Colonel clasping Elsa captive. He looks at Elsa, then back to his father. Everyone is shouting simultaneously. Vogel thrusts the muzzle of the Luger painfully into Elsa's neck, and Elsa shrieks. He drops the submachine gun to the surface and it glides across, fracturing glass. Vogel releases his grasp on Elsa and pushes her toward Indy. She is propelled directly into his embrace, and he holds her firmly. Her hand slips into his jacket pocket and extracts the Grail Diary. She steps back next to Vogel, and Indy is astounded. A large baronial chamber is adorned with ancient hangings and suits of armor. Indy and Henry are escorted in, hands bound behind their backs, accompanied by Vogel and Elsa and two Nazi sentinels. Elsa crosses the chamber toward a high-backed seat facing the hearth. Indy and Henry do not have the benefit of seeing who is seated in that seat. They only see a hand extend. Indy looks at Henry with astonishment. The man in the seat gets to his feet and turns, unveiling himself to be Walter Donovan. Donovan grins benevolently and flips through the Grail Diary. Elsa rushes to Donovan's side and takes the Grail Diary from him. Elsa takes a glance for herself, then glances up at Indy. Brody disembarks from the train along with the other travelers, a cross-section of Arabs and Tuskens. A man in the crowd holds out a goblet of liquid to Brody, who continues through the crowd past various street merchants. A woman holds a fowl out to him, and then the woman walks away, leaving Brody solitary in the crowd. Sallah pushes his way through the mob toward Brody. They meet and embrace, then begin to stroll. Brody searches in his jacket pocket for the chart as a menacing man nears, and Brody puts the chart back in his pocket.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description:
Certainly! Here is the transformed text with active and passive voices switched:

The vase has been concentrated on entirely by Henry, and the broken end is being examined carefully by him. The vase is thrown against the wall by Henry where it is shattered. The room where Elsa had been left is rushed back into by Indy and Henry, only to find a Nazi Colonel holding Elsa hostage. Elsa is looked at by him, then he looks back to his father. Everyone yells at once. The barrel of the Luger is jammed painfully into Elsa's neck by Vogel, and a scream is let out by Elsa. The machine gun is dropped to the table by him and it is slid across, shattering glass. The grip on Elsa is released by Vogel and she is shoved toward Indy. She is directly propelled into his arms, and she is held tightly by him. Her hand slips into his coat pocket and the Grail Diary is removed by her. She steps back next to Vogel, and Indy is left stunned. Ancient tapestries and suits of armor decorate a large baronial room. Indy and Henry are ushered in, hands tied behind their backs, while they are accompanied by Vogel, Elsa, and two Nazi guards. The room is crossed by Elsa toward a high-backed chair facing the fireplace. The advantage of seeing who is sitting in that chair is not had by Indy and Henry. A hand reaching out is all they see. Surprise is shown by Indy as he looks at Henry. His feet are gotten to by the man in the chair, and he turns, revealing Walter Donovan. A benign smile is given by Donovan as he flips through the Grail Diary. Donovan's side is rushed to by Elsa, and the Grail Diary is taken from him. She takes a look for herself, then a glance is given to Indy. Brody disembarks from the train along with the other passengers, a cross-section of Arabs and Tuskens. A cup of water is held out by a man in the crowd to Brody, who continues through the crowd past various street vendors. A chicken is held out to him by a woman, and then the woman walks away, leaving Brody alone in the crowd. Sallah shoulders his way through the mob toward Brody. They meet and hug, and then they begin to walk. The map is searched for by Brody in his coat pocket as a sinister man approaches, and the map is put back into his pocket by Brody.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Henry focuses intently on the vase, closely examining its broken end, before throwing it against the wall, shattering it. Indy listens at the door while Henry slides his umbrella through his bag straps, and Indy nods. Henry laughs genuinely, thinking he's mocking the S.S. Officer. Angrily, he snatches a machine gun from a startled soldier and fires, killing three Nazis, shocking both him and Indy. Indy grabs Henry, propelling him down the hallway to find Elsa. Entering a room, they find a Nazi Colonel holding Elsa hostage. Vogel jabs a Luger into Elsa’s neck, making her scream. Indy drops the machine gun on a table, breaking glass, and Vogel releases Elsa, pushing her into Indy’s arms. She stealthily takes the Grail Diary from Indy’s pocket and returns to Vogel. In a baronial room adorned with tapestries and armor, Indy and Henry enter with hands tied. Elsa approaches a chair by the fireplace, and they see a hand. Surprised, Indy looks at Henry as Walter Donovan rises, smiling and flipping through the Grail Diary. Elsa joins Donovan, examining the diary and exchanging glances with Indy. Brody leaves a train with diverse passengers and is offered water while navigating vendors. A woman shows him a chicken and leaves him alone. Sallah finds Brody in the crowd, and they embrace. As they walk, a sinister man approaches, prompting Brody to hide his map in his pocket.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Henry is focused on the vase, examines the broken end, and then shatters it against the wall. Indy listens at the door while Henry secures his umbrella. Henry laughs, mocking an S.S. Officer, and angrily seizes a machine gun, firing and killing three Nazis. Shocked, Indy leads Henry, searching for Elsa, and finds her held by a Nazi Colonel. Vogel threatens Elsa, causing glass to shatter. Vogel releases her, and she manipulates Indy, retrieving the Grail Diary. In a baronial room with tapestries and armor, Indy and Henry, hands tied, are brought before Walter Donovan, who examines the Grail Diary. Elsa joins Donovan, surprising Indy. Meanwhile, Brody navigates through a diverse crowd, offered water and a chicken, and eventually finds Sallah. They reunite and walk, but Brody hides a map from a sinister figure.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Henry, with a focused intensity written clearly across his face, has been devoting his full attention to the vase, scrutinizing the fractured end with utmost care and precision. After his meticulous examination, Henry suddenly hurls the vase against the wall, causing it to shatter into innumerable pieces. At that moment, Indy steps over to the door and stands there, attentively listening and observing the scene unfold. Meanwhile, Henry, with a swift and practiced motion, slides his umbrella through the straps of his bag, prompting Indy to nod in acknowledgment. Henry, with genuine amusement, laughs heartily, perceiving himself as laughing at the expense of the S.S. Officer. In a fit of anger, he forcefully seizes a machine gun from the grip of one of the stunned soldiers. Turning with determination, he unleashes a spray of relentless machine gun fire throughout the room, striking all three Nazis with precision and sending them hurtling backward across the space. Henry is left in a state of shock and horror at the chaotic scene. Indy, acting quickly, grabs Henry and urges him forward, taking charge as he guides him down the hallway in search of Elsa. Pushing open a door, they enter the room, hastily returning to where they had left Elsa, only to be confronted by the grim sight of a Nazi Colonel holding Elsa as a hostage. Indy's eyes shift from Elsa, then back to his father, as the room erupts into a cacophony of shouting voices. Vogel, with menacing intent, jams the barrel of his Luger painfully into Elsa's neck, eliciting a scream from her lips. In a swift motion, he lets the machine gun fall onto the table, where it slides across, crashing into glass and shattering it. Vogel relinquishes his hold on Elsa and shoves her forcefully in Indy's direction, propelling her directly into his waiting arms, where he holds her securely. Taking advantage of the moment, her hand deftly slips into his coat pocket, extracting the Grail Diary without his notice. As she steps back beside Vogel, Indy stands there, utterly stunned by her betrayal. They find themselves in a large, impressive baronial room, adorned with ancient tapestries and suits of armor. Indy and Henry, with their hands bound tightly behind their backs, are ushered into the room, accompanied by Vogel, Elsa, and two Nazi guards. Elsa crosses the room, moving toward a high-backed chair that faces the inviting warmth of the fireplace. Unfortunately, Indy and Henry do not have the advantage of seeing the individual seated in that chair. Instead, they only catch sight of a hand that reaches out. Indy shares a look of surprise with Henry. The man in the chair rises to his feet and turns around, revealing himself to be none other than Walter Donovan. Donovan, wearing a benign smile, casually flips through the pages of the Grail Diary. Elsa, with a sense of urgency, rushes to Donovan's side and takes the Grail Diary from his hands. She glances at its contents herself, then fixes her gaze on Indy, a silent communication passing between them. Meanwhile, Brody disembarks from the train, blending in with the bustling crowd of passengers, a diverse mix of Arabs and Tuskens. Out of the crowd, a man offers a cup of water to Brody, who, absorbed in his thoughts, continues to weave his way through the crowd, passing by various street vendors. A woman briefly holds out a chicken to him, then, without a word, walks away, leaving Brody momentarily alone amid the throng. Just then, Sallah pushes his way through the dense mob to reach Brody. Their reunion is marked by a warm embrace, and they begin to walk together. As they do, Brody searches through his coat pocket for the map, only to notice a sinister man approaching. In response, Brody discreetly places the map back into his pocket for safekeeping.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Henry, with an intense focus etched unmistakably across his face, has been devoting all his attention to the delicate vase, scrutinizing the fractured end with an unparalleled level of care and precision. After conducting his meticulous examination, Henry, in a sudden and unexpected burst, hurls the vase against the wall, causing it to shatter dramatically into innumerable pieces. At that precise moment, Indy steps over to the door and stands there, attentively listening and keenly observing the unfolding scene. Meanwhile, Henry, with a swift and practiced motion, expertly slides his umbrella through the straps of his bag, an action that prompts Indy to nod in acknowledgment of the gesture. 

Henry, with genuine amusement lighting up his features, laughs heartily, perceiving the moment as one in which he is laughing at the expense of the S.S. Officer. However, consumed by a fit of anger, he forcefully seizes a machine gun from the grip of one of the stunned soldiers. Turning with determination burning in his eyes, he unleashes a relentless spray of machine gun fire throughout the room, striking all three Nazis with unerring precision and sending them hurtling backward across the space. Henry is left standing there, engulfed in a state of shock and horror at the chaotic scene that has erupted around him. 

Indy, acting quickly and with purpose, grabs Henry and urgently urges him to move forward, taking charge of the situation as he guides him down the hallway in search of Elsa. They push open a door and enter the room, hastily returning to where they had previously left Elsa, only to be confronted by the grim and foreboding sight of a Nazi Colonel holding Elsa as a hostage. Indy's eyes shift from Elsa to his father, then back again, as the room erupts into a cacophony of shouting voices. With menacing intent, Vogel jams the barrel of his Luger painfully into Elsa's neck, eliciting a scream from her lips. 

In a swift motion, Indy lets the machine gun fall onto the table, where it slides across, crashing into the glass and shattering it. Vogel relinquishes his hold on Elsa and shoves her forcefully in Indy's direction, propelling her directly into his waiting arms, where he holds her securely. Taking advantage of the moment, her hand deftly slips into his coat pocket, skillfully extracting the Grail Diary without his notice. As she steps back beside Vogel, Indy stands there, utterly stunned by the depth of her betrayal. They find themselves in a large room that is both impressive and baronial, adorned with ancient tapestries and suits of armor. 

Indy and Henry, with their hands bound tightly behind their backs, are ushered into the room, accompanied closely by Vogel, Elsa, and two Nazi guards. Elsa confidently crosses the room, moving toward a high-backed chair that faces the inviting warmth of the fireplace. Unfortunately for Indy and Henry, they do not have the advantage of seeing the individual seated in that chair. Instead, they can only catch sight of a hand that reaches out. Indy shares a look of surprise with Henry. The man in the chair then rises to his feet and turns around, revealing himself to be none other than Walter Donovan. Donovan, wearing a benign smile, casually flips through the pages of the Grail Diary with interest. 

Elsa, with a sense of urgency and determination, rushes to Donovan's side and takes the Grail Diary from his hands. She glances at its contents herself before fixing her gaze on Indy, a silent communication passing between them. Meanwhile, Brody disembarks from the train, blending seamlessly into the bustling crowd of passengers, a diverse mix of Arabs and Tuskens. Out of the crowd, a man offers a cup of water to Brody, who, absorbed in his thoughts, continues to weave his way through the crowd, passing by various street vendors. A woman briefly holds out a chicken to him, then, without uttering a word, walks away, leaving Brody momentarily alone amid the throbbing throng. Just then, Sallah pushes his way through the dense mob to reach Brody. Their reunion is marked by a warm embrace, and they begin to walk together. As they do, Brody searches through his coat pocket for the map, only to notice with increasing apprehension a sinister man approaching. In response to this, Brody discreetly places the map back into his pocket for safekeeping, ensuring its protection.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Henry is completely engrossed in examining the vase, focusing intently on the broken end with meticulous care, assessing every detail and crack. In a sudden burst of action, Henry hurls the vase forcefully against the wall, watching as it shatters into numerous pieces. Meanwhile, Indy moves deliberately to the door and stands there, attentively listening for any sounds or movements. With a swift motion, Henry slips his umbrella through the straps of his bag as a sign of readiness, prompting Indy to acknowledge him with a nod. Henry then erupts into genuine laughter, feeling a sense of triumph at mocking the S.S. Officer, driven by a surge of boldness and anger. Overwhelmed with rage, he violently seizes a machine gun from the grip of a startled soldier, feeling its weight and power. In a decisive move, he pivots and unleashes a barrage of bullets across the room, tearing through the three Nazis and causing them to be violently thrown backward. Henry's expression transforms into one of shock and horror as he comprehends the aftermath. Indy acts quickly, grabbing Henry and pushing him ahead, guiding him with urgency down the hallway as he searches intently for Elsa. Upon reaching a door, Indy opens it and steps inside, navigating the space with determination. Indy and Henry hurry back into the room where Elsa was last seen, only to be confronted by a Nazi Colonel who has taken Elsa hostage. Indy shifts his gaze from Elsa to his father, assessing the dire situation as chaos erupts with everyone yelling. Vogel, with menacing intent, presses the barrel of his Luger painfully into Elsa's neck, eliciting a scream from her. Indy, reacting swiftly, drops the machine gun onto the table, allowing it to slide across and crash into glass, causing further destruction. Vogel loosens his grip on Elsa and forcefully shoves her toward Indy, and she stumbles directly into his arms, where he holds her securely. In a subtle maneuver, her hand finds its way into his coat pocket, extracting the Grail Diary without his immediate notice. She then retreats to stand beside Vogel, leaving Indy in a state of stunned realization. The scene shifts to an ornate baronial room adorned with ancient tapestries and suits of armor, where Indy and Henry are escorted in with their hands bound behind them, flanked by Vogel, Elsa, and two Nazi guards. Elsa strides purposefully across the room to a high-backed chair positioned by the fireplace. From their vantage point, Indy and Henry can only see a hand reaching out from the chair, adding to their suspense. Indy exchanges a surprised glance with Henry as the man in the chair rises and turns, revealing himself to be Walter Donovan, whose smile is both benign and unsettling. Donovan leafs through the Grail Diary with a sense of triumph, while Elsa hurries to his side to take possession of the diary, glancing at its contents before looking up at Indy. Meanwhile, Brody disembarks from the train amidst a diverse group of Arabs and Tuskens, blending into the bustling crowd. A man offers Brody a cup of water, which he acknowledges as he navigates through the throngs of people, passing by vendors and their displays. A woman presents a chicken to him, then abruptly moves on, leaving Brody momentarily isolated in the crowd. Sallah pushes his way through the gathered mass, his eyes searching for Brody until they finally meet, exchanging a heartfelt embrace before walking together. Brody instinctively reaches into his coat pocket to retrieve a map but becomes aware of a sinister figure approaching, prompting him to discreetly return the map to his pocket for safekeeping.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Henry studies the broken end of the vase before hurling it against the wall, where it shatters. Indy listens at the door while Henry secures his umbrella, and then nods to Henry, who laughs at the S.S. Officer's expense. Enraged, Henry seizes a machine gun from a soldier and fires, killing the three Nazis. Shocked, Henry is led by Indy down the hallway in search of Elsa. They enter a room where a Nazi Colonel holds Elsa hostage. As tensions rise and everyone shouts, Vogel uses his Luger to intimidate Elsa, who screams. Indy’s dropped machine gun shatters glass as it slides across a table. Vogel releases Elsa, pushing her into Indy’s arms, where she retrieves the Grail Diary from his pocket, and steps back to Vogel, leaving Indy stunned. 

Indy and Henry are taken, hands bound, into a grand room adorned with tapestries and armor, accompanied by Vogel, Elsa, and guards. Elsa approaches a high-backed chair by the fireplace, where a hand emerges. Indy is surprised to see Walter Donovan rise from the chair and smile as he inspects the Grail Diary. Elsa joins Donovan, taking the diary, and exchanges a glance with Indy.

Meanwhile, Brody disembarks from a train amid a diverse crowd. He navigates through street vendors, briefly interacting with them until left alone. Sallah finds Brody in the crowd, and after a hug, they walk together. Brody checks his coat pocket for the map but discreetly returns it as a sinister figure approaches.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Henry, deeply engrossed in the task at hand, has clearly been concentrating entirely on the vase, an artifact rumored to date back to the Ming Dynasty, and he is examining the broken end carefully. With a sudden burst of frustration, Henry throws the vase against the wall where it shatters into countless pieces. Indy, known for his quick reflexes as an archaeologist and adventurer, steps to the door and stands, listening intently for any sign of danger. Henry slides his umbrella, a sturdy accessory reminiscent of the classic styles popular in Britain, through the straps of his bag, and Indy nods, signaling their mutual understanding. Henry laughs genuinely, believing himself to be laughing at the expense of the S.S. Officer, a notorious faction within the Nazi regime. In a fit of rage, he's so pissed off, he literally rips a machine gun from the hands of one of the startled soldiers. He turns and sprays the room with machine gun fire, cutting all three Nazis to ribbons and blowing them backwards across the room, a vivid scene of chaos and destruction. Henry looks shocked and horrified by the violence. Indy grabs him and pushes him ahead, leading Henry down the hallway of the ancient castle as he searches for Elsa, an Austrian art historian caught in the midst of their perilous quest. He opens a door and enters. Indy and Henry rush back into the room where Elsa had been left, only to find a Nazi Colonel, a high-ranking officer known for his ruthless efficiency, holding Elsa hostage. He looks at Elsa, then back to his father. Everyone is yelling at once, their voices echoing off the stone walls. Vogel, another member of the Nazi faction, jams the barrel of the Luger, a German semi-automatic pistol, painfully into Elsa's neck, and Elsa screams. In the midst of commotion, he drops the machine gun to the table and it slides across, shattering glass. Vogel releases his grip on Elsa and shoves her toward Indy. She is propelled directly into his arms, and he holds her tightly. Her hand, with dexterous precision, slips into his coat pocket and removes the Grail Diary, a journal believed to contain clues to the location of the Holy Grail. She steps back next to Vogel, and Indy is stunned by her betrayal. A large baronial room, reminiscent of medieval Europe, is decorated with ancient tapestries and suits of armor. Indy and Henry are ushered in, hands tied behind their backs, accompanied by Vogel and Elsa and two Nazi guards. Elsa crosses the room toward a high-backed chair facing the fireplace, its back turned to them like a throne of power. Indy and Henry do not have the advantage of seeing who is sitting in that chair. They only see a hand, adorned with a signet ring, reach out. Indy looks at Henry with surprise. The man in the chair gets to his feet and turns, revealing himself to be Walter Donovan, a wealthy American industrialist with a hidden agenda. Donovan smiles benignly and flips through the Grail Diary, its pages filled with arcane symbols. Elsa rushes to Donovan's side and takes the Grail Diary from him. Elsa takes a look for herself, then glances up at Indy, her eyes betraying a mix of emotions. Brody disembarks from the train along with the other passengers, a cross-section of Arabs and Tuskens, a fictional nomadic group from a well-known galaxy far away. A man in the crowd holds out a cup of water to Brody, who accepts it gratefully, a small act of kindness in a bustling marketplace. He continues through the crowd past various street vendors, their stalls filled with colorful textiles and exotic spices. A woman holds a chicken out to him, and then the woman walks away, leaving Brody alone in the crowd. Sallah, an Egyptian excavator and good friend of Indy, shoulders his way through the mob toward Brody. They meet and hug, then begin to walk. Brody searches in his coat pocket for the map, an essential guide to their next destination, as a sinister man approaches, and Brody puts the map back in his pocket, aware of the potential threat.

Indy grabs him and pushes him ahead leading Henry down the hallway as he searches for Elsa. He opens a door and enters. Indy and Henry rush back into the room where Elsa had been left only to find a Nazi Colonel holding Elsa hostage. He looks at Elsa then back to his father. Everyone is yelling at once. Vogel jams the barrel of the Luger painfully into Elsa's neck and Elsa screams. He drops the machine gun to the table and it slides across shattering glass. Vogel releases his grip on Elsa and shoves her toward Indy. She is propelled directly into his arms and he holds her tightly. Her hand slips into his coat pocket and removes the Grail Diary. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. She steps back next to Vogel and Indy is stunned. A large baronial room is decorated with ancient tapestries and suits of armor. Indy and Henry are ushered in hands tied behind their backs accompanied by Vogel and Elsa and two Nazi guards. Elsa crosses the room toward a highbacked chair facing the fireplace. Indy and Henry do not have the advantage of seeing who is sitting in that chair. They only see a hand. reach out. Indy looks at Henry with surprise. The man in the chair gets to his feet and turns revealing himself to be Walter Donovan. Donovan smiles benignly and flips through the Grail Diary. Elsa rushes to Donovan's side and takes the Grail Diary from him. Elsa takes a look for herself then glances up at Indy. Brody disembarks from the train along with the other passengers. a crosssection of Arabs and Tuskens. A man in the crowd holds out a cup of water to Brody who continues through the crowd past various street vendors. A woman holds a chicken out to him and then the woman walks away leaving Brody alone in the crowd. Sallah shoulders his way through the mob toward Brody. They meet and hug then begin to walk. Brody searches in his coat pocket for the map as a sinister man approaches and Brody puts the map back in his pocket.

Indy steps to the door and stands listening. Henry slides his umbrella through the straps of his bag and Indy nods. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Arnold has clearly been focusing entirely on the sandwich, and he is scrutinizing the torn crust intently. Arnold tosses the sandwich towards the window where it crumbles. Max steps to the curtain and pauses, whispering. Arnold threads his shoelace through the loops of his hat, and Max winks. Arnold giggles awkwardly, thinking himself to be amused at the expense of the U.S. Mailman. He's so riled up, he abruptly snatches a lasso from the grip of one of the startled carpenters. He pivots and drenches the hallway with lasso loops, slicing all three librarians to ribbons and launching them sideways across the garden. Arnold appears bewildered and aghast. Max snatches him and nudges him forward, guiding Arnold up the staircase as he searches for Lila. He unlatches a window and exits. Max and Arnold dash back into the attic where Lila had been left, only to discover a librarian Sergeant holding Lila captive. He stares at Lila, then back to his uncle. Everyone is whispering at once. Carmen presses the tip of the pencil sharply into Lila's shoulder, and Lila gasps. He places the lasso on the bench and it glides across, cracking china. Carmen lets go of Lila and nudges her toward Max. She is sent directly into his embrace, and he grasps her tightly. Her fingers slide into his jacket pocket and extract the Recipe Book. She steps back beside Carmen, and Max is flabbergasted. A vast medieval library is adorned with dusty manuscripts and knights' helmets. Max and Arnold are escorted inside, hands bound behind their backs, flanked by Carmen and Lila and two librarian guards. Lila traverses the chamber toward an ornate desk facing the fireplace. Max and Arnold do not have the benefit of seeing who is seated at that desk. They only observe a foot tapping restlessly. Max gazes at Arnold with disbelief. The figure at the desk rises and turns, revealing himself to be Richard Summerville. Summerville grins warmly and flips through the Recipe Book. Lila rushes to Summerville's side and takes the Recipe Book from him. Lila examines it briefly, then peers up at Max. Marley disembarks from the boat along with the other travelers, a cross-section of Swedes and Vikings. A child in the throng offers a basket of strawberries to Marley, who proceeds through the mass past an array of fortune tellers. A man presents a rabbit to him, and then the man strolls away, leaving Marley solitary amid the crowd. Hassan wedges his way through the assembly toward Marley. They converge and embrace, then start to stroll. Marley rummages in his waistcoat pocket for the blueprint as a mischievous child draws near, and Marley slips the blueprint back into his pocket.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Henry focuses on examining a broken vase before suddenly shattering it against a wall. While Indy listens at the door, Henry humorously manages to grab a machine gun from a soldier, shooting down three Nazis, which horrifies Henry. Indy leads Henry to search for Elsa, finding her held hostage by a Nazi Colonel. Amid chaos, Elsa retrieves the Grail Diary from Indy's pocket and joins Vogel, revealing her betrayal. Indy and Henry, bound and accompanied by Nazis, are brought into a grand room where they meet Walter Donovan. Donovan examines the Grail Diary as Elsa stands beside him. Meanwhile, Brody disembarks a train, navigating through a crowd until he meets Sallah. They embrace and walk together as Brody cautiously protects a map from a sinister figure.
